alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:56PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN WARREN AND WEST CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Morrow, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Morrow, South Lebanon, Maineville, Clarksville, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, Oregonia, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Fort Ancient, Middleboro, State Route 350 at US Route 22 and Ogden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
